body.p: The pulmonary circulation has less resistance than the systemic circulation because __________.

multiple_choice.choice: the pulmonary vasculature has smaller diameter vessels
the pulmonary vasculature has both a shorter path length and larger diameter vessels
the walls of the pulmonary vessels are thinner
the pulmonary circulation receives less flow

feedback.p: Incorrect. Decreased diameter leads to greater resistance.
Correct. Major determinants of resistance are vessel length (path length) and vessel diameter.
Incorrect. Although the vessels are thinner, which helps contribute to their increased diameters, thin walls by themselves do not contribute to low resistance (capillaries have very thin walls).
Incorrect. The flow is the same in the pulmonary and systemic circulations, and resistance is not dependent on flow.
